1.description: The capture of Constantinople by the Ottoman Empire, marking the end of the Byzantine Empire.

2.description: Apollo 11 successfully landed on the moon, and Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the lunar surface.

3.description: A period of radical social and political change in France that led to the overthrow of the monarchy.

4.description: A global war involving major world powers, leading to massive destruction and the reshaping of global politics.

5.description: The Berlin Wall was torn down, leading to the reunification of Germany and the end of the Cold War division.

6.eventName: Signing of the Declaration of Independence
6.description: The thirteen American colonies declared independence from British rule, forming the United States of America.

7.description: Coordinated terrorist attacks by al-Qaeda targeting the World Trade Center and the Pentagon, resulting in massive casualties.
7.location: New York City, Washington D.C., and Pennsylvania, USA

8.description: A catastrophic nuclear accident occurred at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, releasing radioactive material across Europe.
8.casualties: Estimated thousands due to radiation exposure

9.description: The RMS Titanic sank after hitting an iceberg, resulting in one of the deadliest commercial peacetime maritime disasters.

10.description: The Japanese military launched a surprise attack on the U.S. naval base at Pearl Harbor, prompting the U.S. to enter World War II.

11.description: Julius Caesar, the Roman dictator, was assassinated by a group of senators on the Ides of March.

12.description: King John of England agreed to the Magna Carta, limiting the powers of the monarchy and establishing certain legal rights.

13.description: Christopher Columbus set sail from Spain and reached the Americas, initiating widespread European exploration and colonization.
participants: Crew of the Santa María, Pinta, and Niña

14.description: The Thirteen American Colonies declared independence from British rule, leading to the formation of the United States of America.

15.description: A pair of revolutions in Russia dismantled the Tsarist autocracy and led to the rise of the Soviet Union.

16.description: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria was assassinated in Sarajevo, triggering the onset of World War I.

17.description: The United Nations was established to promote international cooperation and prevent future conflicts.
participants: Charter Members of the United Nations

18.description: A 13-day confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union over Soviet ballistic missiles deployed in Cuba.

19.description: The Soviet Union was officially dissolved, leading to the independence of its constituent republics.

20.description: Coordinated terrorist attacks by al-Qaeda on the United States, resulting in significant loss of life and global impact.
20.location: New York City, Washington D.C., Shanksville

21.description: The United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union in a national referendum.

22.description: The World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a global pandemic, leading to worldwide health and economic crises.

23.description: The American colonies fought for independence from British rule, resulting in the formation of the United States of America.

24.description: A pair of revolutions in Russia dismantled the Tsarist autocracy and led to the rise of the Soviet Union.

25.description: The heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne was assassinated in Sarajevo, triggering the onset of World War I.
25.casualties: 2 (Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife Sophie)

26.description: A severe worldwide economic depression that took place mostly during the 1930s, beginning with the stock market crash in the United States.

27.description: A surprise military strike by the Imperial Japanese Navy against the United States naval base at Pearl Harbor, leading to the U.S. entering World War II.

28.description: A 13-day confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union over Soviet ballistic missiles deployed in Cuba.

29.eventName: Assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.
29.description: Civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee, leading to nationwide mourning and unrest.

30.description: Coordinated terrorist attacks by al-Qaeda on the United States, resulting in significant loss of life and leading to the War on Terror.
30.location: New York City, Washington D.C., Shanksville (Pennsylvania), USA

31.description: A global pandemic caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, leading to widespread illness, death, and significant impacts on daily life and economies worldwide.

32.eventName: Hunga Tonga-Hunga Haapai Eruption and Tsunami
32.description: The underwater volcano Hunga Tonga-Hunga Haapai erupted, causing a tsunami and atmospheric disturbances felt worldwide.

33.description: Russia launched a large-scale military invasion of Ukraine, leading to ongoing conflict and international sanctions against Russia.
